query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Avvegna che la subitana fuga 2 dispergesse color per la campagna, 3 rivolti al monte ove ragion ne fruga,
query.error: **English:** 1 Although the sudden flight 2 scattered those people across the countryside, 3 we turned towards the mountain where reason urges us,
query.result: 1 Erbynnas an tebel flogan dowr 2 a dhiberthas an bobel a-dreus an pow, 3 ni a droas dhe'n menydh lemmyn ni a-houl,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 i’ mi ristrinsi a la fida compagna: 5 e come sare’ io sanza lui corso? 6 chi m’avria tratto su per la montagna?
query.error: **English:** 4 I drew close to my faithful companion: 5 and how could I have run without him? 6 who would have led me up the mountain?
query.result: 4 ow kewsel dhe'n kever chywir fydhlon: 5 ha marow vythsa heb ytho? 6 pandra vyth a-hweg dhe'n menydh?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 El mi parea da sé stesso rimorso: 8 o dignitosa coscïenza e netta, 9 come t’è picciol fallo amaro morso!
query.error: **English:** 7 He seemed to me remorseful of himself: 8 oh dignified and pure conscience, 9 how a small fault is a bitter pang to you!
query.result: 7 Ytho dhe'n kever owth a-dhiwedhes gans y honan: 8 ow koweth teg ha glan, 9 marow byghan yw peth owth a-dhiwedhes dhe'th!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Quando li piedi suoi lasciar la fretta, 11 che l’onestade ad ogn’ atto dismaga, 12 la mente mia, che prima era ristretta,
query.error: **English:** 10 When his feet abandoned their haste, 11 which propriety saps from every action, 12 my mind, which was previously restricted,
query.result: 10 Pandra y dreus a-berthas an flogan, 11 owth a-dhiberth an onester an pub tra, 12 owth a-dhiberth ow menow, owth a-dhiwedhes kyns,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 lo ’ntento rallargò, sì come vaga, 14 e diedi ’l viso mio incontr’ al poggio 15 che ’nverso ’l ciel più alto si dislaga.
query.error: **English:** 13 expanded its intention, as if eager, 14 and I turned my face towards the hill 15 that rises highest towards the sky.
query.result: 13 a-dhiberthas ow entent, marow owth a-hwhel, 14 ha owth a-droas ow hweg dhe'n bry, 15 owth a-dhiberth an ughella dhe'n nef.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Lo sol, che dietro fiammeggiava roggio, 17 rotto m’era dinanzi a la figura, 18 ch’avëa in me de’ suoi raggi l’appoggio.
query.error: **English:** 16 The sun, which was flaming red behind me, 17 was broken in front of me by the figure, 18 which had the support of its rays in me.
query.result: 16 An howl, owth a-flamm ow roug, 17 a-dhiberthas ow kensa dhe'm, 18 owth a-gavas dhe'n kever an skoedh a'y rousow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 19 I turned to the side with fear 20 of being abandoned, when I saw 21 only the dark earth in front of me;

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Vespero è già colà dov’ è sepolto 26 lo corpo dentro al quale io facea ombra; 27 Napoli l’ha, e da Brandizio è tolto.
query.error: **English:** 25 Evening is already there where the body 26 in which I cast a shadow is buried; 27 Naples has it, and it is taken from Brindisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Ora, se innanzi a me nulla s’aombra, 29 non ti maravigliar più che d’i cieli 30 che l’uno a l’altro raggio non ingombra.
query.error: **English:** 28 Now, if nothing casts a shadow before me, 29 do not be more amazed than at the heavens 30 that one does not obstruct the rays of the other.
query.result: 28 Mes, mar nyns eus nevra dhe'm owth a-skoedh, 29 na wra'th ow magh dhe goel ages a'n nefow, 30 owth a-dhiberth an eil y gila dhe'n gila.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 A sofferir tormenti, caldi e geli 32 simili corpi la Virtù dispone 33 che, come fa, non vuol ch’a noi si sveli.
query.error: **English:** 31 To suffer torments, hot and cold, 32 the Virtuous One disposes similar bodies 33 that, as she does, she does not want to reveal to us.
query.result: 31 Rag dhe dhugga poenys, tomm ha yen, 32 an Virtus a-dhiposa korfow par, 33 owth a-wul, marow hi a-wul, na wra'th dhe'n ni dhe dhiskwedhes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Matto è chi spera che nostra ragione 35 possa trascorrer la infinita via 36 che tiene una sustanza in tre persone.
query.error: **English:** 34 Foolish is he who hopes that our reason 35 can traverse the infinite path 36 that a substance holds in three persons.
query.result: 34 Fol yw an kever a-wul ow reson 35 a-alli dhe drehedhes an fordh anfeth 36 owth a-berth sustans yn tri person.

query.prompt:

49 Tra Lerice e Turbìa la più diserta, 50 la più rotta ruina è una scala, 51 verso di quella, agevole e aperta.

query.result: 49 Ynter Lerice ha Turbìa an moy difeyth, 50 an moy torrys ruina yw skell, 51 dhe geverel dhe henna, es ha aghes.

query.prompt:

query.prompt:

61 «Leva», diss’ io, «maestro, li occhi tuoi: 62 ecco di qua chi ne darà consiglio, 63 se tu da te medesmo aver nol puoi».
query.error: **English:** 61 "Lift up," I said, "master, your eyes: 62 behold, over there is someone who will give us advice, 63 if you cannot get it from yourself."
query.result: 61 "Codh," meuris, "mester, dha lyga: 62 sel neb ow kodha dhe-nugyn a wra gonsel dhe-nugyn, 63 mar nyns eus ow kodha hy dhe-dhys."
